intro: [WRONG START] Gunnioopsis tenuifolia, commonly known as the slenderleaf gunniopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in wetlands and along stream banks, preferring moist, sandy soils. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered in some regions, making conservation efforts crucial for its survival.
